citation.article-title: Ehrlichia chaffeensis, a new species associated with human ehrlichiosis.

p.s: Description of Ehrlichia chaffeensis sp. nov.
Ehrlichia chaffeensis (chaf.fe.en.sis, N. L. fem. adj. chaffeensis, coming from Fort Chaffee, Ark., where the isolate originated)

Ehrlichia chaffeensis exhibits all the characteristics of the genus Ehrlichia; i.e., it exhibits cytoplasmic growth, appears as compact clusters ("morula"), is found in circulating leukocytes, and has strong serologic cross-reactivity with the type species (E. canis).
The type strain is the Arkansas strain (ATCC accession no. CRL 10679), which was isolated from a U.S. Army recruit at Fort Chaffee, Ark., who was diagnosed as having human ehrlichiosis.
